headline: David D. Glass Dies at 84; Ran Walmart and Won a World Series
abstract: He introduced selling groceries alongside general merchandise in Supercenters, positioning Walmart to compete with Amazon today. His Royals won a World Series.
lead_paragraph: David D. Glass, who as chief executive of Walmart stores led the worldâ€™s largest retailer through one of its greatest periods of expansion, and who also owned the Kansas City Royals when they won the 2015 World Series, died on Jan. 9. He was 84.
